```{r,echo=FALSE}
prm = c(2,3,5,7)
pqrs = sample(prm)
p = pqrs[1]
q = pqrs[2]*sample(c(-1,1),1)
r = pqrs[3]
s = pqrs[4]*sample(c(-1,1),1)

eq1 = paste0("(",p,"x+",q,")(",r,"x+",s,")=0",collapse="")
eq1 = gsub("+-","-",eq1,fixed=T)

eq2 = paste0(p,"x+",q,"=0",collapse="")
eq2 = gsub("+-","-",eq2,fixed=T)
op2 = c("Add","Subtract")[round(sign(q)/2+1.5)]
eq2b = paste0(p,"x=",-q,collapse="")

eq3 = paste0(r,"x+",s,"=0",collapse="")
eq3 = gsub("+-","-",eq3,fixed=T)
op3 = c("Add","Subtract")[round(sign(s)/2+1.5)]
eq3b = paste0(r,"x=",-s,collapse="")

ach = character()
for(i in prm){
    prm2 = prm[prm!=i]
    for(j in prm2){
        ach = c(ach,paste0("x=\\frac{",j,"}{",i,"}"))
        ach = c(ach,paste0("x=\\frac{",-j,"}{",i,"}"))
    }
}
al = paste0("* $",ach,"$",collapse="\n")

cc1 = paste0("x=\\frac{",sign(-p*q)*abs(q),"}{",abs(p),"}")
cc2 = paste0("x=\\frac{",sign(-r*s)*abs(s),"}{",abs(r),"}")

sol1 = ach==cc1
sol2 = ach==cc2
sol = sol1+sol2
sol = paste0(1*(sol),collapse="")

```


Question
========

Find the values of $x$ that make the following equation true. (In other words, solve the equation.)

$$`r eq1`$$

Answerlist
--------

`r al`

Solution
========

Use the zero-product property. This tells us the solutions can be found by solving both of the following equations: $`r eq2`$ and $`r eq3`$.

1. Start with the first one.
$$`r eq2`$$
`r op2` `r abs(q)`
$$`r eq2b`$$
Divide both sides by `r p`.
$$`r cc1`$$


2. Now do the second one.
$$`r eq3`$$
`r op3` `r abs(s)`
$$`r eq3b`$$
Divide both sides by `r r`.
$$`r cc2`$$
